div.p: Take a video tour of a different District classroom every week!

a.title: Go to comments for Classroom of the Week

div.p: Featured in February: Ferderbar Elementary School

a.title: Go to comments for District Art Gallery

div.p: Neshaminy is pleased to recognize those staff members that make significant contributions to our mission.

a.title: Go to comments for The We Build Futures Award

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.title: Go to comments for District Alerts

span.p: All Neshaminy schools will be closed from March 13, 2020 until the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Please see the Neshaminy Coronavirus information page below for updates, resources and additional updates during this closure.

img.title: Continuity of Learning / We Got This banner
img.alt: Continuity of Learning / We Got This banner

strong.span: Phase III of Online Learning begins Monday, April 13, 2020.
This phase is mandatory for all students in grades K-12 and counts toward grade-level requirements.
For more information please visit the COVID-19 information center.

span.p: April 8: Introducing Canvas for Neshaminy elementary schools! Find out about this great digital tool thatis already the hub of online learning at Neshaminy middle schools and Neshaminy High School, and is now rolled out for our elementary students.

March 31: The latestNeshaminy Update District Newsletterhas been posted and includes an important message from Superintendent Jones and other information about the COVID-19 closure and online learning.
March 30: To request an additional Chromebook, please fill out the online form foundhere.You will be contacted with a future date and time for pick-up.

March 26: Need a Chromebook? The Chromebook Request Form can be found here. Please fill it out online and you will be contacted with instructions for when and where to pick up your Chromebook. Please limit one District Chromebooks per 2 students living in the same household.

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: COVID-19 information link button

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus info

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: The Neshaminy Board of School Directors announces the following public meetings for the month of April 2020.These meetings will be virtual meetings.Information regarding connecting to the virtual meetings will be posted onNeshaminy.org/meetingson the evening of the meeting.

ul.li: April 14 -- Public Work Session, Board of School Directors; 7:00 p.m.
April 21 -- Educational Development Committee Meeting; canceled
April 21 Business Operations Committee Meeting; 6:30 p.m.
April 23 Facilities & Planning Committee Meeting; 6:30 p.m.
April 28 Regular Meeting, Board of School Directors; 7:00 p.m. (originally scheduled for April 29)

a.title: Go to comments for School Board Meetings

p.span: Vaping: What you need to know

span.p: The Neshaminy HS parent group SPIN hosted a valuable presentation on the dramatic rise in vaping product use among teenagers. Certified Prevention Specialist David Fialko presented the latest information about the health effects, marketing and prevelance of vaping. A video of the presentation can be viewed here.

a.title: Go to comments for Vaping presentation

span.p: What's happening around Neshaminy?Check out the latest edition of the Neshaminy Update newsletter to find out!

a.title: Go to comments for Newsletter

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Registration for the 2020 Neshaminy Summer Stock theater program and Summer Instrumental Music Instruction program is still open. At this point the program will commence in July, 2020. Any changes will be announced here and through direct communications. Please visit this website for information and registration forms.

a.title: Go to comments for Summer Stock

span.p: If you have not registered your child for kindergarten yet, theprocess can be started online by visiting the Neshaminy Central Registration site.You will be contacted with instructions to complete registration.

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten registration

p.span: Free & Reduced Price Meal Program at Neshaminy

ul.li: Letter to Neshaminy families about the Free & Reduced Meal Program(PDF)

li.a: Free & Reduced Meal Program information & application web page

a.title: Go to comments for Free & Reduced Meal Program

span.p: All school volunteersmust completebackground checks to ensure the safety of our students and comply with Pennsylvania law. For new volunteers this process can take 2-4 weeks, so we encourage all potential volunteers to complete this process in advance to avoid being left out of field trips or in-school volunteer activities. Please visit theNeshaminy volunteer web pagefor more information on this process.

a.title: Go to comments for Volunteer information

span.p: The Neshaminy app is availablefor Apple and Android and can be downloaded for FREE at their online app stores. The app is a great way to connect with the District,receiveimportant alerts, see information about your child and their school, and contactour staff.

a.title: Go to comments for Get the Neshaminy app!

span.p: Neshaminy is introducing the Safe2Say app on Thursday, April 10 in the middle schools and Neshaminy High School. Please click on the links below for more information about this important safety tool:

li.a: Safe2Say Something introductory video for students

a.title: Go to comments for Safe2Say

span.p: For information about all other positions at Neshaminy, please visit our employment web page for information on current vacancies and application materials.

a.title: Go to comments for Neshaminy works
